wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Mayo VC (18 May 1840 – 18 May 1920) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: Three former students have won the Victoria Cross: Arthur Mayo during the Indian Mutiny; and George Pearkes and Brett Mackay Cloutman, both during the First Word War.

link_mentions.page: List of alumni of Hertford College, Oxford
response: * Arthur Mayo, recipient of the Victoria Cross
Arthur Mayo is the name of:
*Arthur Mayo (VC) (1840–1920), English Naval Officer and recipient of the Victoria Cross
